author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_repos/reporter.c
(APR_SIZE_MAX): Following up on r36033, define APR_SIZE_MAX if it is not
defined by apr. (E.g. APR 0.9)

author: gstein
msg: Remove a test case which failed on posix. The particular test was already
listed just below in the #if platform blocks, so the entry was spurious.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/dirent_uri-test.c:
(test_dirent_entryname): remove spurious test case from tests[]

author: gstein
msg: Followup to 36043: commit the build.conf.
* build.conf: add new 'db-test'

author: gstein
msg: Begin implementing the wc_db interface, starting with base_get_info.
Unit test included.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.h:
(svn_wc__db_base_get_info): provide more detail in the docstring
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c:
(upgrade_sql): new array for upgrading the datastore
(enum statement_keys): new enumeration of the available sql statements
(statements[]): new array of sql statements
(word_to_kind): new function to map a word string to a kind value
(kind_to_word): new function to map a kind value to a string
(fetch_repos_info): fetch repository information for a given repos_id
(scan_upwards_for_repos): when a node specifies NULL for the repos_id
and/or repos_relpath, then a scan up the tree is performed, to find a
node that *does* define them. a repos_id is returned along with a
newly-constructed repos_relpath.
(parse_local_abspath): given an input path of a node to work on, this
function selects the appropriate sqlite database, wc_id, and relative
path within that wcroot. the current code makes many assumptions for
now.
(svn_wc__db_base_get_info): implement
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc/db-test.c: new unit test
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc/: adjust svn:ignore for the above

author: gstein
msg: Some minor simplifications.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_files.c:
(init_adm_tmp_area): take a target path rather than an access baton.
remove the check for the write lock, assuming caller has done that.
(init_adm): adjust call to init_adm_tmp_area
(svn_wc__adm_cleanup_tmp_area): adjust call to init_adm_tmp_area.
